entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 2:20PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... Conditions remain dry across Southeast Alaska and temperatures will continue to rise to the upper 70s and lower 80s again on Friday with relative humidity values falling into the lows 20s. Fine fuels are dry and there is a risk of camp fires getting out of control. Winds will remain light, which is a mitigating

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 1:53PM AKDT until June 03 at 9:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues due to warmer temperatures. * WHERE...Including the following area, Copper River Basin. * WHEN...Until 200 PM AKDT Monday.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 8:27PM CDT until June 02 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL COVINGTON COUNTY... At 826 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southeast of Andalusia, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued June 02 at 8:27PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL COVINGTON COUNTY... At 826 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southeast of Andalusia, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 8:11PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Covington County through 900 PM CDT... At 811 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Andalusia. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued June 01 at 8:55AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY THURSDAY... The Pinal County Department of Air Quality has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for Pinal County including Apache Junction, Casa Grande, Coolidge, and Florence on Thursday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 8:57PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Pasco and northern Pinellas Counties through 930 PM EDT... At 857 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near New Port Richey East to East Lake to near Clearwater. Movement was west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 02 at 5:09PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Potential Tropical Cyclone One is forecast to move northeast towards the southern Florida peninsula through late week. This system is expected to bring locally heavy rainfall amounts of four to six inches with locally higher amounts. The heavy rainfall may produce flooding along creeks and rivers and in urban, poor drainage and low lying areas.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coastal Indian River; Inland Indian River

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued June 02 at 7:32PM EDT until June 03 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 7:48PM CDT until June 02 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Cannon and Rutherford. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 8:03PM CDT until June 03 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Denton Creek Near Justin affecting Denton County. For the Denton Creek...including Justin...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 6:16PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lewis County through 645 PM PDT... At 616 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Packwood, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:57PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Columbia County through 630 PM PDT... At 556 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ski Bluewood, or 12 miles south of Dayton, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:54PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Adams County through 645 PM PDT... At 552 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles south of Ritzville, or 25 miles northeast of Connell, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 02 at 3:52PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH SUNDAY WITH A RISK OF LOCALIZED FLOODING... Periods of moderate to heavy rain associated with showers and thunderstorms will continue through Sunday over portions of central and eastern Washington and eastern Oregon.
